# Master Test Strategy: Saucedemo E-Commerce Application

This document outlines the master test strategy for the Saucedemo e-commerce application, ensuring a robust and reliable testing process. It serves as a blueprint for the entire engineering team, guiding test automation and execution efforts.

## 1. 🔍 RISK ASSESSMENT & PLANNING

*   **Domain Analysis:** Saucedemo is an e-commerce platform. The core business functions revolve around product browsing, adding to cart, and completing the checkout process. Failure in these areas directly impacts revenue and user experience.
*   **Risk Profile:** System failures can lead to:
    *   **Financial Loss:** Inability to process orders.
    *   **Reputational Damage:** Negative user experience due to bugs and errors.
    *   **Loss of Trust:** Users may abandon the platform if they encounter frequent issues.
*   **Testing Scope:**
    *   **In Scope:**
        *   Authentication (Login/Logout)
        *   Product Catalog (Viewing, Sorting)
        *   Shopping Cart (Adding, Removing, Updating)
        *   Checkout & Payments (Order Placement)
    *   **Out of Scope:**
        *   Performance Testing (Load, Stress) - *Initial focus is on functional correctness.*
        *   Security Testing (Penetration, Vulnerability Scanning) - *Separate security assessment required.*
        *   Accessibility Testing - *To be addressed in a later phase.*
        *   Detailed UI/UX Testing - *Focus on core functionality first.*

## 2. 🏗️ TESTING STRATEGY (The "How")

This strategy focuses on a risk-based approach, prioritizing critical functionalities and high-impact scenarios.

*   **Smoke Suite (Sanity):**
    *   **Definition:** A minimal set of tests to verify the core functionality of the application after each build.
    *   **Goal:** Ensure the application is in a stable state for further testing.
    *   **Test Cases:**
        1.  **Login with `standard_user`:** Verify successful login.
        2.  **Product Catalog Load:** Verify product catalog page loads successfully.
        3.  **Add Low-Cost Item to Cart:** Verify a low-cost item can be added to the cart.
        4.  **Checkout Completion:** Verify the checkout process can be completed successfully.
    *   **Execution Frequency:** After each build deployment.
    *   **Pass/Fail Criteria:** If any smoke test fails, the build is rejected.

*   **Regression Suite (Deep Dive):**
    *   **Definition:** A comprehensive suite of tests to ensure that new changes haven't introduced regressions in existing functionality.
    *   **Goal:** Maintain the stability and reliability of the application.
    *   **Test Cases (Examples - to be expanded):**
        *   **Authentication:**
            *   Login with invalid credentials.
            *   Logout functionality.
        *   **Product Catalog:**
            *   Sort products by price (high to low).
            *   Filter products by category.
            *   Search for a specific product.
        *   **Shopping Cart:**
            *   Update quantity of items in the cart.
            *   Remove items from the cart.
            *   Handle out-of-stock items.
        *   **Checkout & Payments:**
            *   Checkout with different shipping addresses.
            *   Handle payment failures.
            *   Verify order confirmation.
    *   **Execution Frequency:** After each sprint or major feature release.

*   **Data Strategy:**
    *   **Test Data:** A combination of static and dynamic data will be used.
        *   **Static Data:** User credentials (`standard_user`, `locked_out_user`, etc.) will be stored in a configuration file.
        *   **Dynamic Data:** Product names, quantities, and shipping addresses will be dynamically generated or retrieved from a test data pool.
    *   **Data Management:** A dedicated data management strategy will be implemented to ensure data integrity and avoid conflicts.

## 3. 🏛️ ARCHITECTURE GUIDANCE (For the Test Architect)

*   **Framework Recommendation:**
    *   **Page Object Model (POM):** This design pattern will be used to create reusable and maintainable test code. Each page of the application will be represented as a Page Object, encapsulating the elements and actions on that page.
    *   **Language:** Python with pytest
    *   **Libraries:** Selenium, Requests
*   **Resilience Strategy:**
    *   **Flakiness Handling:**
        *   **Polling Assertions:** Use explicit waits and polling assertions to handle asynchronous operations and dynamic content loading.
        *   **Retry Mechanism:** Implement a retry mechanism for failed tests due to transient issues.
        *   **Self-Healing:** Explore self-healing techniques to automatically identify and fix broken locators.
    *   **Test Environment:**
        *   A dedicated test environment that mirrors the production environment will be used.
        *   Regular environment refreshes to ensure data consistency.

## 4. ⚔️ EXECUTION & MINING INSTRUCTIONS (For the Senior QA)

*   **Mining Targets:**
    1.  **Login Page:** `https://www.saucedemo.com/` - Focus on login functionality with different user roles.
    2.  **Inventory Page:** `https://www.saucedemo.com/inventory.html` - Focus on product listing, sorting, and filtering.
    3.  **Cart Page:** `https://www.saucedemo.com/cart.html` - Focus on adding, removing, and updating items in the cart.
    4.  **Checkout Pages:** `https://www.saucedemo.com/checkout-step-one.html`, `https://www.saucedemo.com/checkout-step-two.html`, `https://www.saucedemo.com/checkout-complete.html` - Focus on the entire checkout flow, including address input, payment processing, and order confirmation.
*   **Verification Criteria:**
    *   **Successful Login:** HTTP 200 status code AND "Products" text visible on the inventory page.
    *   **Product Added to Cart:** HTTP 200 status code AND the cart icon displays the correct number of items.
    *   **Checkout Completion:** HTTP 200 status code AND "Thank you for your order!" text visible on the confirmation page.
    *   **General:** Verify no JavaScript errors are present in the console.

This Master Test Strategy provides a solid foundation for testing the Saucedemo e-commerce application. It will be reviewed and updated regularly to adapt to changing requirements and evolving risks.
